programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Plymouths history during the Elizabethan era, visiting the home of the citys most famous son, Sir Francis Drake, and uncovering his history of piracy and slave trading - all carried out with approval from the Queen. She also discovers the revolutionary shipbuilding techniques that helped defeat the Spanish Armada, while aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson highlights the physical characteristics that made Plymouth Harbour such an attractive base for pirates

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts is in Glasgow to investigate the impact of steam power on Britains major towns in the 18th and 19th centuries. She also learns about the arrival of migrant workers in the city and how the insanitary conditions in which they lived, which made Glasgow both a hotbed of disease and a place of great medical advancement. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson flies his drone over Loch Katrine as he tells the story of how Victorian engineers overcame geographical barriers to bring fresh drinking water to the workers of Glasgow

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Edinburgh and its role in the union between England and Scotland. She discovers how the famous case of Burke and Hares bodysnatching influenced British medical law, and visits the Royal Bank of Scotland, where she uncovers evidence of the worlds first overdraft. Plus, the role played by Henry Dundas, whose statue stands in St Andrews Square, in the continuation of the slave trade

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits Manchester to explore the spirit of protest and revolution that grew out of the experience of Britains working class during the Industrial Revolution. At the John Ryland Library, Alice is granted access to rarely-seen period documents that highlight the true human cost of the Peterloo massacre. At the Free Trade Hall, she explores how Manchester found itself at the heart of the battle against the hated Corn Laws, and at Chethams Library, Roberts sits at the very desk where Friedrich Engels and Karl Marx, inspired by the living conditions of Manchesters working poor, began the discussions and research that would lead to the publication of the Communist Manifesto

programme.desc: The lives of Protestant missionaries Marcus and Narcissa Whitman, who sought to spread their Christian faith and bring their way of life to the Cayuse people. programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.sub-title: A Lost Tudor Hall in Odiham
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team are in Odiham, Hampshire, searching for the house of Sir Frances Walsingham, the head of Elizabeth Is Secret Service. It is the first time the site has ever been dug, so with very little to go on, our team want to locate the house, work out its size and scale, and what Walsingham may have used it for. As part of the investigation, Hugh turns his hand to spy craft as he learns how Walsingham used to break codes

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones heads to the south-east of England to explore the turbulent history of Dover Castle. He reveals that Henry II ordered its construction not only as a statement of royal power, but also out of guilt for the murder of Thomas Becket, the Archbishop of Canterbury, in 1170. Dan discovers how a vast network of tunnels was used to defend the castle, including underground barracks built during the Napoleonic Wars and a nuclear bunker created during the Cold War

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Competition boils over when bitter rivals Brandon and Jesse throw down over a storage unit containing an amazing movie monster and a potential $100,000 payout. Security steps in, but can they separate the boys before the blood hits the floor?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The gigantic statues of Easter Island, which have mystified humanity for centuries. This documentary explores the ancient Polynesian civilization that created the Moai structures, focusing on how they carved and transported the immense monoliths and the purpose and cultural significance behind them. The film highlights the enigmatic nature of the Moai, which are scattered across the island, and the challenges researchers face in understanding the islands history and the people who inhabited it

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the turbulent history of the Tower of London, which is one of Britains most famous buildings and has been a military fortress, a palace, a royal mint, a prison, a zoo and a place of execution. He reveals how one kings obsession with money led to the Tower becoming the focus of the worst Jewish massacre the country had ever seen and explains how a mob of disgruntled peasants managed to break through its defences as they sought bloody revenge for taxes they could no longer put up with

programme.desc: On Chicagos North Side, Mike and Jersey get VIP access to a sprawling historic home that features four floors of dazzling high-end antique toys

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are tasked with creating a signature Damascus blade out of three different steels of different thicknesses. The two final competitors re-create one of the most intricate weapons in history - the steel crossbow.

programme.title: Bone Detectives: Britains Buried Secrets
programme.desc: In a Bristol graveyard, Tori Herridg and the team investigate the grisly discovery of sliced-open human skulls and explore their connection with a local hospital, a celebrated surgeon, and the crime of body-snatching

programme.title: Historys Most Shocking
programme.sub-title: Sucked Up by a Tornado, Elevators Gone Wrong, Motorcycle v Flood and the Indian Ocean Tsunami of 200
programme.desc: Tony Harris breaks down the most shocking moments ever captured on camera. This episode features a woman nearly sucked up by a tornado, a commuter train in Russia colliding with the back of another train and elevators free-falling around the world. Plus, deadly mudslide disasters and killer whales, known as orca, attacking a boat

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The gigantic statues of Easter Island, which have mystified humanity for centuries. This documentary explores the ancient Polynesian civilization that created the Moai structures, focusing on how they carved and transported the immense monoliths and the purpose and cultural significance behind them. The film highlights the enigmatic nature of the Moai, which are scattered across the island, and the challenges researchers face in understanding the islands history and the people who inhabited it

programme.title: Secrets Declassified with David Duchovny
programme.desc: The actor explores hidden government facilities and their secret operations, from a Soviet poison lab to a nuclear site under Greenlands ice and a US doomsday bunker inside a mountain

programme.title: Alien Corridors
programme.desc: Patterns in UFO and UAP sightings across the world. Nearly 3.7 million people claim to have experienced something not of this Earth. Most are dismissed, ignored or silenced, but they cannot all be wrong. A team of multi-disciplined experts - believers and critics - investigates what Alien Corridors are and what they mean

programme.title: The UnBelievable with Dan Aykroyd
programme.desc: The star of Ghostbusters, Blues Brothers and Trading Places reflects on the fact that history is riddled with discoveries, from gold, to lost treasures, to scientific findings. Some discoveries are anything but ordinary, such as severed feet on a beach, or finding evidence of a tiny otherworldly creature. Indeed, each is often weirder than the last

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny tiptoes down memory lane, Brandi and Jarrod get to work on a tool locker, while Darrell and his granddaughter dig up a creepy find

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers lose their minds in West Covina, California. Kenny hunts for cougars, but finds a portable pulpit instead. Ivy shows the ladies how to dress for success

programme.desc: The Governor enlists the services of the unit on the eve of an election, tasking officers to handle a delicate investigation involving a dead prostitute found in the bed of a missing congressman. programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A manhunt is sparked when an HPD officer is killed by a sniper in broad daylight, and the team discovers that the bullet casing was engraved with the victims name. When another cop is executed by the criminal in the line of duty, McGarrett finds himself delving into his fathers past to prevent more shootings. Crime drama, directed by and guest starring Peter Weller (RoboCop), with Alex OLoughlin and Scott Caan

Sci-fi drama, starring Alaina Huffman

programme.desc: An irate tourist causes havoc. In Biosecurity, officer Renee uncovers some unwelcome hitch-hikers

programme.title: Stargate Universe
programme.desc: Part one of two. Young tries to undo the Lucian Alliance brainwashing by interrogating Telford, who reveals the Destiny is in danger of being boarded, so the crew launches a pre-emptive attack. Meanwhile, Kiva tries to force a captive Rush to recreate a dialling programme

programme.title: Stargate Universe
programme.desc: Part two of two. Young and Kivas confrontation is interrupted as the Destiny is affected by power surges and Rush discovers a binary pulsar emitting radiation that has the potential to kill everyone on board

programme.title: Wild Sky
programme.desc: Cameras capture footage of polar bears hunting under the aurora, track a polar vortex and follow a prairie dog family dodging tornadoes

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Marge try to breathe new life into their relationship by canoodling in public places, while Bart and Lisa use Grampas metal detector to hunt for hidden treasure

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa attends a performing arts camp, where guitar-playing counsellors and musically inclined youngsters teach her to embrace her creative side. Meanwhile, Bart and Homer accompany Just the Clown to Norway, where he hopes to collect a Nobel Prize for his contributions to the comedy world. With the guest voices of Jemaine Clement and Bret McKenzie of Flight of the Conchords, and Glee stars Lea Michele, Cory Monteith and Amber Riley

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A dead body falls on to a 4x4 belonging to none other than reality TV star Dog the Bounty Hunter (making a brief guest appearance) and the ensuing investigation leads the team to the local roller derby - so Catherine puts her skates on in an attempt to find a killer. Meanwhile, Doris has a run-in with a burglar who makes off with a box containing details of her entire black ops career. Alex OLoughlin, Scott Caan and Christine Lahti co-star

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The owners of a tour company accused of endangering the local shark population fall victim to a string of arson attacks - but the persecution turns deadly with the discovery of an employees body at the bottom of a submerged shark cage. On a less grisly note, Kamekona hones his helicopter flight simulation skills in the hope of securing a pilots licence

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Thomas and Higgins help an Amish teenager who has travelled to Hawaii in search of his runaway sister, while Rick sets out to find TC a date for the Marine Corps ball

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: Tan finds himself on a one-man mission to save his new love interest and her journalist co-workers when mercenaries take over a black-tie correspondents dinner. Hondo and Nichelle return home to find their house trashed, placing them at odds when its revealed that she has a secret, while Hicks, Mumford and Buck take a trip down memory lane that threatens to end their decades-long friendships

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Grampa gives each member of the family $50, and Lisa anonymously donates her money to Nelson to support his dream of making custom bicycles. During a visit to an upmarket department store, Marge decides to buy an expensive handbag and promises Homer she will return it. When the item is successfully returned for a full refund, despite signs of wear and tear, Homer is inspired to buy things he cannot afford with the intention of taking them back at a later date

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A tax audit leads Homer into big trouble, leaving him with no choice but to make amends by helping the government nail Mr Burns for the theft of a trillion-dollar banknote

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael feels guilty about the incident with Meredith and decides to host a charity fun run in aid of rabies awareness

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jim and Pams relationship is revealed after Toby files a PDA complaint, while Ryan returns to the offices for the first time since his promotion.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa is persuaded to work on her extracurricular activities by her new idol Dahlia Brinkley, Springfield Elementarys only pupil to make it to an Ivy League college. The student seizes the opportunity to coach Barts Little League team, but sibling rivalry soon takes hold and there is more bickering than baseball

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Lisa Simpson, This Isnt Your Life
programme.desc: Lisa is dumbfounded to discover Marge was an A-grade student, and decides to investigate how she ended up being an ordinary Springfield housewife. Bart accidentally dethrones Nelson as the playground bully, and Maggie becomes obsessed with a collectable elf figurine

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Global Adventure: The Rise of Nature
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the rise of life on Earth, from the emergence of the first creatures on seabeds hundreds of millions of years ago to the wildlife of today

programme.title: Romesh: Cant Knock the Hustle
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan heads to a motivational speakers boot camp in Arizona to learn how to smash the day. From there, he travels to South Korea to experience their work culture in a happy factory and learns how AI could change the future. In Mumbai, he experiences hustle culture in the slums, which could provide the key to happiness, before he tries out an interesting revenue stream

programme.title: Insidious: Chapter 2
programme.desc: A couple previously tormented by paranormal activity discover their nightmares are not over. As more strange events occur, they turn to a group of paranormal investigators for help in uncovering the dark secrets that connect them to the spirit world. Horror sequel, starring Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne and Barbara Hershey

programme.title: Brassic
programme.desc: Vinnie is trying to lay low, until a new, younger gang are spotted and appear to be rivalling his crew in local dodgy dealings. Comedy, starring Joe Gilgun

programme.title: Peacemaker
programme.desc: Superhero action comedy, starring John Cena, Danielle Brooks and Freddie Stroma

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: An officer tries to stop a man from hurting himself, and lawmen confront a driver who refuses to hand over her correct details

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Documentary following the Thames Valley Police as they use unmarked cars fitted with on-board video cameras, offering an insight into vehicle crime and how it can be prevented. The programme also features shocking footage of dangerous drivers

programme.title: Ryder Cup Memories
programme.desc: Luke Donald shares his memories of the remarkable 2012 Ryder Cup in Medinah, where the European team made a staggering comeback to win on the final day. The Americans went into the final day with a 10-6 lead, needing just 4.5 points from the 12 singles matches to win, but the Europeans won eight and tied one of the 12 singles matches to claim a famous 14.5-13.5 victory

programme.title: Live MNF
programme.desc: Everton v West Ham United (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Premier League match from Hill Dickinson Stadium. The Hammers have managed to pick up four points from their last two visits to Everton, including an impressive 3-1 victory in early 2024. Both meetings between these two sides ended as draws last season, with this fixture finishing 1-1 in mid-March, and the reverse ending in a drab 0-0 draw

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Miami Dolphins v New York Jets (Kick-off 12.15am). Coverage of the week four match at Hard Rock Stadium. The Jets have struggled against the Dolphins in recent years and have only picked up two victories in the last 10 meetings between the two teams since 2020. However the visitors did impress in the last fixture between the sides when they beat Miami 32-20 in a comprehensive win in New York

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Denver Broncos v Cincinnati Bengals (Kick-off 1.15am). Coverage of the week four match from Empower Field at Mile High. These two teams last met in December last year in an exciting game that went into over-time. The Bengals eventually won that game 30-24 to claim their second consecutive victory against the Broncos

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: India v Sri Lanka. Coverage of the opening group match from Barsapara Cricket Stadium, Guwahati, as the two co-hosts go head to head. India have never won this tournament before and will be hoping home advantage will come into play. They have made it to two finals in this competition but have lost on both ocassions, first to Australia in 2005, then again in 2017 when they lost to tournament hosts England

programme.title: Live: Serie A
programme.sub-title: Live Serie A: Genoa v Lazio
programme.desc: Genoa v Lazio (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the Italian top-flight match from Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris. These two sides last met here back in April in a fiery encounter that saw both teams reduced to 10 men. Sebastian Otoa was sent off for the hosts after just 21 minutes, before Lazio scored either side of the break to take a 2-0 lead. Reda Belahyane was then sent off for the visitors in the 72nd-minute but it didnt affect them as they held on to win 2-0

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Homes for Veterans - Part One
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team take on their most ambitious project to date and transform a whole street of run-down empty properties in Manchester into homes for veterans. They are joined by the local community, as well as Prince William and Prince Harry, who volunteer their assistance on site. In the first edition of the two-part special, the team builds houses for two former soldiers who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan and are suffering from post traumatic stress disorder. However, with the number of volunteers lacking and the buildings proving to be trickier than expected, the build is becoming the toughest yet

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Contestants arrive in Doha, and for their first challenge of the trip its a mystery box with local ingredients where the top two dishes will win immunity

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Football pundit Lee Dixon brings his beloved rescue dog to see Professor Noel Fitzpatrick, looking for help treating a limp and getting his pet back to full fitness. Elsewhere, a Springer Spaniel all the way from Guernsey is brought in for spinal surgery, and a Caucasian Shepherd puppy called Bear requires two hip replacements

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: In the first of a new series, Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his team treat a giant Newfoundland puppy with a painful knee and shoulder. What appears straightforward quickly turns into a much bigger concern, and Noel and his team are challenged to invent not one but two new implants for her. Meanwhile, a rescue black Labrador called Moogi is in need of treatment for severe elbow arthritis, and a golden Labrador born with a deformed front paw is offered a bionic solution in the form of a unique, custom-made prosthesis

programme.title: Dog School
programme.desc: Bella the Newfoundland has her first daycare groom, but staff have to coax her out of the lake and into the shower, while Henry the Labradors play is restricted because of his joints

programme.title: Louis Theroux: The City Addicted to Crystal Meth
programme.desc: The roving journalist examines how drug addiction has torn apart the city of Fresno in Central Valley, California. In addition to meeting a couple whose crystal meth use has lost them custody of their five children, he talks to a mother trying to kick the habit to make up for missing her daughters childhood, and witnesses the work being carried out at residential centre Westcare, which offers rehabilitation programmes

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance

programme.title: One Born Every Minute

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Homes for Veterans - Part Two
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team continue with their most ambitious project to date, with the assistance of the local community and two royal helpers, Prince William and Prince Harry. The second edition sees them create a home for a veteran, who is a triple amputee after an IED blew up in Afghanistan. They are also aiming to renovate the fronts of the houses on the street and put in new utilities, as well as creating a lasting legacy in the form of a support centre, which will help other veterans find homes and jobs

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Liverpool Womens Hospital opens its doors to 16-year-old Heidi, who is accompanied by her own mum Jo, and Adele, the mother of the babys father, who has decided to take her sons place in the delivery room. Dad-to-be Gavin hopes poetry will help his jittery wife Michelle get through giving birth to their second child, and 46-year-old Jane finds herself laughing through her daughter Louises contractions as a means of coping with the stress of being a birthing partner

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: Caroline treats a father of four with severe pancreatitis, Rhona restores a patients health with a large blood transfusion, and Sarah cares for a mum with incurable stomach cancer

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: Three newly-qualified nurses Renee, Caitlin and Military Nurse James cope with the pressures of working for the NHS and finding a work-life balance

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants are sent to Wotton House, a grand hotel in the Surrey Hills, where they must each transform one of the nine bedrooms to create a space that reflects their signature style but with an eccentric British twist. The designers relish the challenge, embracing the idea of British eccentricity, although some take a more liberal approach, leading to surprising results. Alan Carr follows their progress, while helping Michelle Ogundehin survey the spaces is guest judge Guy Oliver, who has designed the interiors for some of the best-known hotels in London

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a 49-year-old who has fallen in the street after a night out in Stoke, while in Dudley, paramedics visit a five-month-old who has a temperature

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos journey through eastern England takes him to the Snape Maltings music and arts venue, the Norfolk seaside resort of Great Yarmouth and the city of Norwich. Plus, he learns how the music and life of one of Britains greatest composers was shaped by the sea and his Suffolk surroundings

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo completes his rail journey through 1930s Britain, beginning in Norfolk at the headquarters of an international horse welfare organisation. In Peterborough, he visits a tidal defence barrier that helped save the city from flooding, while in Lincolnshire crosses the point at which the Mallard broke the speed record for a steam-powered locomotive in 1938. After a spell in the coastal town of Skegness, Michaels journey ends at RAF Coningsby where he sees some iconic Second World War aircraft, before witnessing a dazzling display featuring the RAFs latest combat aircraft

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out on the first leg of a trip from London to Edinburgh aboard the Flying Scotsman, beginning at Kings Cross as he heads for York

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores a Swiss garden in Bedfordshire, drives a locomobile, and at Rothampsted, he discovers the Victorian origins of the fertiliser industry

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Up for auction this week is a 1980 Ford Escort, a hand-built 1946 Bedford 12 electric car, and a beautiful, red 1957 Austin Healey.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a beautifully restored and carefully modified 1936 Wolseley 14/56. Meanwhile, a Batman-inspired Chrysler Crossfire is dropped off at the Thornton le Dale garage

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: After the Nuremberg trial, the most senior ranking Nazis had been executed or imprisoned - but many of the worst criminals were still at large. They included Adolf Eichmann, who arranged the transportation of millions of Europes Jewish people to death camps, and Nazi secret police chief Klaus Barbie, who became known as the Butcher of Lyon because of his reputation for extreme cruelty. This documentary follows the hunt for these two war criminals

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Walmer Castle, Kent, and is challenged to identify a valuable 18th-century glass out of a collection of reproductions. Other items brought in to be valued include a rare pottery piglet, a revolving table with secret compartments, a British PoWs diary, a set of French fashion illustrations from the 1920s, a table clock and a collection of Victorian ceramic birds

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from Walmer Castle in Kent, where the team values a jacket worn by President Kennedy that could be one of the most valuable items ever featured on the series. Other items brought in include an art deco mask that terrifies its owners children, an enamel advertising sign, and a letter from Lord Nelson that has an unexpected connection to the owners dead husband

programme.title: Incredible Journeys with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon looks back on some of the most incredible wildlife stories he has discovered on his travels, from a giant tortoise sanctuary in the Seychelles to armed conservationists defending a forest in Belize. Catching up with old friends, Simon discovers how one of his programmes help protect a crucial whale sanctuary off the coast of Australia

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The third leg of the adventurers journey takes him from the south of Kenya to the Horn of Africa. Along the way he joins a Ugandan peace-keeping force in Mogadishu, the capital of war-torn Somalia, which turns out to be the most dangerous leg of his journey as he ends up under fire on the front line. In contrast, he finds neighbouring Somaliland a stable and democratic home to thousands of Somalis fleeing fighting and famine. In Kenyas Tana Delta, he meets villagers facing eviction from an area that the government is turning over to sugar cane production for bio-fuels

programme.title: Russia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The concluding leg of the adventurers epic journey begins in Crimea, which is part of neighbouring Ukraine but was annexed by Russia in 2014. Simon meets the eccentric and fearless owner of a safari park who likes to get up close and personal with his pride of lions, then comes across a small hospital where he meets an inspirational doctor trying to protect his clinic from closure. Arriving in Moscow he meets a woman who was arrested for protesting against her flat being demolished, and finally arrives in St Petersburg, where he joins fighters at a martial arts club

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Darlington to Dunbar, following the route taken by George Stephensons steam engine on its 1825 journey, and visiting Lewis Carrolls childhood home

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo enjoys a ukulele lesson in Haddington, East Lothian, birthplace of the Victorian self-improvement guru Samuel Smiles. In Musselburgh, he gets a taste of life as a fishwife, before exploring Edinburgh where a popular 19th-century mode of transport is making a comeback. Michael also visits the Royal College of Surgeons, where he discovers the macabre history of body snatchers and murderers and heads onwards to the University of Edinburgh Medical School, to learn how students use sophisticated technology to study anatomy

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: The continuing story of the diehards committed to hunt down thousands of Nazi war criminals, some of whom were living in plain sight. One such woman was German Beate Klarsfeld, determined to right the wrongs of her countrys dark past and identify Nazis who had gone unpunished - including the notorious Klaus Barbie. The documentary also tells the story of Josef Mengele - who performed gruesome experiments on Auschwitz inmates - and the son so appalled by his fathers actions he considered turning him in

programme.desc: The story of Americas ‘Liberty Ships, which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Kairat Almaty v Real Madrid (Kick-off 5.45pm). Coverage of the matchday two league phase contest at Almaty Ortalyk Stadion. The hosts lost their opening match 4-1 away to Sporting Lisbon and now face a daunting test against the 15-time champions, who came back from behind to win 2-1 at home to Marseille last time out

programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Chelsea v Benfica (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the match from the second round of fixtures, held at Stamford Bridge. Both teams experienced disappointment in matchday one, with the Blues losing 3-1 away to Bayern Munich, and Benfica parting company with manager Bruno Lage after suffering a shock 3-2 defeat at home to Qarabag. Lage has been replaced by former Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho, who will be eager to make an instant impression
